speaker: Outstanding Directing for a Comedy Series
text: David Lee  ENTERTAINMENT WEEKLY    *  **Reader's Favorites: 5TH**  ## Nominated  EMMY
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series

speaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series
text: Ron Volk  * * *  ## Transcript {nicholas hartley}     _Act One.  Scene One - Apartment Martin is sat in his Armchair reading the paper, Daphne is sat at the table writing a letter.  Daphne notices something._
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Directing for a Comedy Series

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh dear, your chair's got another big rip in the bottom.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series

speaker: Martin
text: [_looks_] Where? [_spots it_] Oh!  Hand me my re-upholstery kit, would you? [_She slings him a large roll of duct tape_] Thanks.  _He kneels down to patch the rip.  Frasier comes out of the hall dressed in his best suit._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, don't you look smart.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't feel smart.  I let Roz set me up another one of her blind dates.

speaker: Daphne
text: Who's the lucky woman?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, a friend from her aerobics class.  Oh, perhaps it won't be so bad.  She's thirty-two, has a terrific body, and apparently thinks I'm God's gift to broadcasting.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, at least you have one thing in common.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, when are you going to stop blighting the environment with this atrocity? [_doorbell_] My God, can't you see that it wants to die?  Let it go!

speaker: Martin
text: [_sits back down_] You know, I keep having this dream where you say the same words.  Only I'm in the hospital and you're slipping the nurse a twenty.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, that will never happen.

speaker: Martin
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: I have medical power of attorney, it won't cost me a thing.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.  We were in the neighborhood for a pedicure and a seaweed wrap and we thought we'd stop by.  Of course, the pedicure was for...

speaker: Martin
text: Stop right there!  There's no way to finish that sentence that'll make me proud.

speaker: Niles
text: I have some wonderful news.  I just signed a lease for an apartment in one of the most exclusive buildings in Seattle.

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't mean?

speaker: Niles
text: I do.  As of next week, I'll be a resident of... [_holds out his lease_] the Montana.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, why would you want to live in such a stodgy building? When I applied there they treated me as if I was riff-raff.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, if you're going to answer your own questions, what do you need me for?  The best part is, I'll never have to give my address again.  From now on, I'll simply be, "Dr. Niles Crane, The Montana."

speaker: Daphne
text: That's a lovely building.  I've only been there once, applying for a job.

speaker: Niles
text: I can't imagine anyone turning down a chance to hire you.

speaker: Daphne
text: I hope you're right, I haven't heard yet.  Well, goodnight!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Frasier, you don't...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just relax, dad.  It's just her way of angling for more vacation time.

speaker: Martin
text: What if she isn't?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, they'd still have to call me for a reference.  Either way, she's not going anywhere.

speaker: Niles
text: Gosh, that's uncanny, dad.

speaker: Martin
text: What is?

speaker: Niles
text: The way she's taken with you.  She's absolutely mesmerized.

speaker: Martin
text: She is not.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, she is.  She's just playing hard to get. [_pushes Girl toward Martin_] Go to Grampa.  Isn't she warm and cuddly? [_Martin reluctantly takes her on his lap_] Oh, I see I'm going to have a tough time tearing you two apart!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm going to go out on a limb here.  The Montana doesn't accept pets, does it?

speaker: Niles
text: On the contrary, they welcome them.  Just not cats or dogs.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, then you're in luck, because I don't know what the hell this thing is!

speaker: Frasier
text: There is no way that dog is moving in here with us!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh please, at least if she's here I'll be able to come and visit her.  I cannot turn her over to strangers. [_whispering confidentially_] She worships me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh pul-eeze, you must realise that dog has no genuine affection for you. [_Niles looks confused_] You only pretend that she does because she's a canine substitute for Maris!

speaker: Niles
text: That is the most absurd psychobabble I have ever heard.

speaker: Frasier
text: She is highly strung, cold to the touch and ignores you. My God, stand her upright, take ten pounds off her, put her in a Chanel suit, whatcha got?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, that's ridiculous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, is it really?  Do you remember that little pilbox hat that Maris wore to the the Duchamps' wedding?

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely. _Frasier takes a small dip bowl and puts it at a cocked angle on Girl's head.  As Martin nods in agreement, Niles staggers backward against the couch.  FADE OUT_  **JUST CALL ME STINKY**  _Scene Two - KACL. The next day, Frasier enters his booth.  Roz is waiting with a clipboard._

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Frasier.  So how did it go with Rita last night?

speaker: Frasier
text: She didn't quite take to me.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you're just being hard on yourself like you always are.

speaker: Frasier
text: You tell me.  Over appetizers, she suddenly remembered that she had a very early morning meeting, so she suggested we skip the jazz club after dinner.

speaker: Roz
text: People have meetings.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm-hmm.  When the waiter suggested a souffle for desert that would take an extra thirty minutes she said, "Oh Dear God, no!"

speaker: Roz
text: She was probably on a diet.

speaker: Frasier
text: After I dropped her off at home, I noticed she had left her suede jacked in my car.  I called to offer to swing it by and she said, and I quote, "Just keep it."

speaker: Roz
text: What did you do to her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing!  God Roz, I have had it.  In the past six months I have done _everything_ a man can possibly do to meet a woman. Singles bars, blind dates, lecture series at the museum. I've even spent hours in the grocery store trying to look helpless in the produce department!  That's it.  I'm taking myself off the market.  Frasier Crane has thumped his last melon.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, Roz, please.  I know what you're going to say.  I should climb back on that horse, I'm too great a catch to give up now.

speaker: Roz
text: No, I think you should give up.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_startled:_] What?  I don't really want to give up.  I don't really want to give up, I was just saying that to get your sympathy.

speaker: Roz
text: It happens sometimes.  When you get into a really bad streak, you start to get desperate.  Women can smell it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Smell it?

speaker: Roz
text: Mmm-hmm.  As soon as the man begins to get overeager - you know, like complimenting you too much, or laughing too hard at all your jokes - you just want to turn and run!

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't do that!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh honey, wake up and smell... well yourself!  You just have to air it out a little bit.  And in my experience, the minute you stop looking, the perfect person falls right in your lap.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Roz, as much as I appreciate you comparing me to a dead squirrel in a heating duct, I think you're wrong.

speaker: Christine
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey.

speaker: Christine
text: I got those pictures you were looking for.  Hey, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, you look really lovely today, Christine.  It is Christine, isn't it?

speaker: Christine
text: That's what it says on my driver's license.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs hard_] Very charming. [_Roz and Christine leave_] Oh God, I reek, don't I? _FADE TO:  Scene Three - The Montana Niles is completing the tour of his new, stylish apartment with Daphne and Martin.  The decor and furniture are as expensive and classy as Frasier's, but the style is a little older.  They end up on the small balcony overlooking the main room._

speaker: Niles
text: ...inlay of Philippine mahogany.  And we conclude our little tour back here in the living room.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's very posh. [_doorbell_]

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, why a bed in the living room?

speaker: Niles
text: That's not a bed, dad.  It's an antique fainting couch.

speaker: Daphne
text: My goodness, they had furniture for everything back then, didn't they!

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, I'm glad you made it.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, this precious little building of yours isn't as exclusive as you think.  Your doorman waved me right through.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that's because he knows you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, fan of my show?

speaker: Niles
text: No, he lives in your building.

speaker: Martin
text: So Niles, what did you do about the dog?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I found a wonderful family to adopt her.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm sure it won't take you long to adjust to being alone again.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, actually I won't have to.  Follow me, there's someone I'd like you to meet.  It was love at first sight!  She's very exotic, only eats every other day, and she's so white she's almost blue! [_exits to the kitchen_]

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, I'm getting nervous.  That's what he said just before he introduced us to Maris! _The gang enter Niles's kitchen, where a cockatoo is perched on his shoulder._

speaker: Niles
text: Everybody, meet Baby.

speaker: Baby
text: I love you.

speaker: Frasier
text: You bought a bird?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I started to think how quiet it would be around here, and she is lovely and she is so affectionate.

speaker: Baby
text: I love you.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah!  She says that all the time.  I love you too, baby.

speaker: Baby
text: I love you, grandma.

speaker: Niles
text: She's still in transition from her last owner. _The door buzzer sounds, causing Baby to squawk and dig her claws into Niles's shoulder._

speaker: Niles
text: Ow, ow!  Let go of my shoulder!  You don't like that noise, do you, baby?  Go to your food. [_she does_] Oh, good girl. Excuse me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh you know, I've always been fascinated by these birds that can actually learn how to talk.

speaker: Martin
text: [_walks to Baby_] Aw, they can't talk.  They just a drill a few words into them at the pet shop and they never learn anything else after that.

speaker: Frasier
text: It is attractive, though.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah well, that's the way they are: Cute but stupid.

speaker: Baby
text: Cute but stupid!  _Martin straightens up, surprised.  Baby mimics him.  Martin nods his head, Baby does the same.  He starts bobbing up and down..._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know Daphne, I think we should leave these two alone. I sense a real battle of wits shaping up. _Martin carries on.  Frasier enters the living room as Niles shuts the door with mail in hand._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm off to an auspicious start in the building.  One of my neighbours got my mail by mistake.  Look at those bills, what must she think of me?

speaker: Frasier
text: But Niles, everyone gets bills.

speaker: Niles
text: Not at the Montana.  They all have people.  Their bills go to their people.  I want them to think I have people too. I used to have people... only they were Maris's people.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, if you keep this up you won't even have the people who don't care you don't have people.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it just shows how essential it is to make a good impression when moving into a new building, which is why I'm throwing a dinner party Friday night for a few select residents.  I'll show them such a good time there'll be no question that I belong here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Am I invited?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes you are, but I'm afraid you can't bring a date.  You know how I hate a crowded table.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's alright.  I've taken myself off the dating circuit. I'm afraid I was getting a bit desperate.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I was a bit concerned when you called to ask if Gloria was our first or second cousin.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, you gotta see this, your bird's eating peanut butter! It's even funnier than when Eddie does it!

speaker: Niles
text: Dad!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, would you get that?  And pretend you're my people.  _Niles rushes into the kitchen to stop Martin whilst Frasier answers the door to a woman; Stephanie Garret._

speaker: Stephanie
text: Oh, I'm sorry, I was looking for Dr. Crane.  I found some more of his mail.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm a Dr. Crane.  I'm Niles's brother.

speaker: Stephanie
text: Oh my gosh, you're Frasier Crane from the radio, aren't you? Oh, I love your show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Stephanie
text: Oh, Stephanie Garret.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shakes hands_] Stephanie.

speaker: Stephanie
text: You know, em, you are not going to believe this but when I was a freshman at Harvard, I saw you perform the pirate king in a production of "Pirates Of Penzance."

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God.

speaker: Stephanie
text: No, no, you were great.  You were so good, I brought my husband back to see you the next night.  Well, he wasn't my husband then.  Well, actually he's not my husband now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Glad to hear that.  No, glad to hear you came for a second time, not that you have an ex-husband.  You know, I have one too.  Not a husband, ex-wife.  I mean a woman... is it getting hot in here?

speaker: Stephanie
text: Yeah, a bit! [_flustered laugh_] Well, it was nice to meet you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, you know, Niles is having a little party on Friday for some of his enchanting new neighbors. [_Niles appears listening in_] Is there any chance you could join us?

speaker: Stephanie
text: Yes, I think I could, if Niles has room.

speaker: Niles
text: [_faked:_] The more the merrier!

speaker: Stephanie
text: I'll look forward to it. [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: As will I.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz was right!  As soon as I stop looking for the perfect woman, she falls right in my lap!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I hope you'll be comfortable with that arrangement, because that's where she'll be seated Friday night!  _End Of Act One. (Time: 10:20)  Act Two._  **GET A GRIP** _Scene One - The Montana In his apartment, Niles is setting the table with Baby on his shoulder._

speaker: Niles
text: Bon Appetite, Bon Appetite.  Now, you try it, Baby.  Bon Appetite.

speaker: Baby
text: Bon Appetite.

speaker: Niles
text: What a quick little study you are.  Bird-brained indeed!  You already know more French than my father.

speaker: Niles
text: Ow!  Boy, if you don't get used to that doorbell we're going to have to give you a serious manicure. [_sounds again and she digs in_] Ow!  I'm coming, I'm coming, stop ringing!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good evening, Niles.  Or should I say, "avast ye, matey!"

speaker: Niles
text: I don't have time for your badinage, I'm only just putting out my place cards.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_picks up card_] Place cards, how elegant.  Who is Peter Soutendeck?

speaker: Niles
text: He's on your right.  He's an investment banker from Amsterdam, and apparently he handles a lot of Bill Gates's money.  So don't say anything derogatory about the Netherlands or Microsoft.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, damn.  There goes my opening joke about the Dutchman trying to install Windows '95. [_looks_] Stephanie's over here, I'm not sitting next to her.

speaker: Niles
text: I know, you see, Peter's bringing a date so I thought it would be better... [_spots Frasier re-arranging:_] What are youdoing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Putting Stephanie next to me!

speaker: Niles
text: And throwing off my whole seating arrangement?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, surely you realise I've spent a long time looking for a woman like Stephanie.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, listen.  I'm afraid if you want to impress these people you've got to get a little more atmosphere here in the room. You know, I'll light the fire while you dim the lights a bit.

speaker: Niles
text: [_runs to lights_] Oh, that's a good idea.  By the way, be careful with that fireplace, it can be a bit...  _It's too late and Frasier causes the fire to flare up suddenly, causing Baby to jump onto Niles's head and dig her claws in.  The flame shrinks immediately, but Baby stays put._

speaker: Niles
text: Holding on a bit tight there, Baby, aren't you?  Go to your perch.  Go to your perch. [_Baby doesn't move_] Frasier, this bird's holding onto my scalp. [_tries to move her but she won't budge_] I can't pull it off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, after that jaunty beret you wore to brunch last Sunday, you can pull anything off.  _Niles and Frasier attempt to pull it off.  Frasier begins pulling sharply which only causes distress for Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: Get the lighter.  Put fire near my head.  Fire will frighten her off.  Try that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh here, the phone.  _He hands the phone to Niles who holds it next to his head and tries to get the bird to perch on the aerial.  Frasier is surprised._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, call for help!

speaker: Niles
text: And who do you suggest we call, a Fez rental?  Go on, Baby, go to your perch. [_panicking:_] Go to your food, go to your bed!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, don't panic!  Try to stay calm.

speaker: Niles
text: How can I stay calm?  I have six dinner guests arriving in exactly...

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, ow!

speaker: Frasier
text: You go call the vet and I'll go and take care of things out here.  _Niles rushes to the kitchen whilst Frasier answers the door to Stephanie._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello.

speaker: Stephanie
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please come in.

speaker: Stephanie
text: [_looking around_] I'm not early, am I?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, not at all.  May I get you a drink?

speaker: Stephanie
text: Ah, yes.  White wine, please. [_they head to the wine desk where Frasier pours_] What a lovely table! [_points to dining area_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I notice we happen to be sitting next to one another.

speaker: Stephanie
text: Good, now I won't have to change the place cards around.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, [_lifts glass_] to the girl next door.

speaker: Stephanie
text: Well, actually it's a little further down the hall.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if you need a ride home tonight don't hesitate to ask.

speaker: Stephanie
text: What was that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm afraid Niles probably burned himself on something. Don't worry, he'll be fine.  _He answers the door to three more guests, an elderly couple and a younger woman._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, please do come in.  I'm Frasier Crane, Niles's brother.

speaker: Carol
text: I'm Carol Larkin, my husband Alfred, this is our niece, Wella.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nice to meet you.  Please make yourself comfortable, I'm just going to run into the kitchen and check on the bird.  _Frasier enters the kitchen where Niles is on the phone to the vet. Imagine the sight._

speaker: Niles
text: [_on phone:_] Uh-huh, uh-huh, so you've seen this thing before. I see.  Alright, well, thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: What did he say?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, he thinks she was traumatized by the fire and she had a shock.  He said we shouldn't try to force her off, we need to relax her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine, you take care of that, I've got the future Mrs. Crane out there in the other room.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, wait, wait, wait, wait, how am I supposed to relax this bird?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.  Oh, try delivering that keynote you gave at the psychiatric association last spring.

speaker: Frasier
text: Everything alright out here?

speaker: Alfred
text: Will Dr. Crane be joining us soon?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, I believe so, any minute now. _The doorbell sounds again, which causes more audible distress for Niles._

speaker: Carol
text: Oh dear, something wrong?

speaker: Frasier
text: I keep telling him, get yourself a decent oven mitt, but you know...

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, please come in.  I'm Frasier, Niles's brother.

speaker: Peter
text: Peter Soutendeck, nice to meet you.  This is Elanie Hensley.

speaker: Elaine
text: Actually your brother and I are well acquainted.  Maris is a dear, dear friend of mine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Elaine
text: Yes, [_looks_] so where is he?

speaker: Frasier
text: He's in the kitchen, savoring for you tonight a lovely pheasant.

speaker: Frasier
text: As you know, he's a stickler for freshness!  _Frasier runs to the kitchen where Niles is standing with Baby still on his head, but with a towel over her.  Try and imagine the sight._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what now?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm trying to pretend like it's night so it'll fall asleep.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you look very cute.

speaker: Baby
text: Cute but stupid!

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen Niles, I really can't stall them any longer, they're starting to ask questions.  The Dutchman's date even knows Maris.

speaker: Niles
text: What?  What's her name?

speaker: Frasier
text: Elaine somebody.

speaker: Niles
text: Which Elaine?  Maris knows three Elaines.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know, she's very thin, she's exquisitely dressed, and dripping with attitude.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, like that narrows it down!  _Frasier and Niles pop their head round the door spying on Elaine taking a sip from her drink.  They go back to the kitchen._

speaker: Niles
text: Damn!  I was afraid of that, it's the bad Elaine, Maris's oldest friend.  Nothing would delight her more than to report back to Maris that I threw a soiree with a cockatoo on my head!

speaker: Baby
text: Bon Appetite!

speaker: Elaine
text: What was that?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_entering with crab puffs and covering up:_] Bon Appetite! Crab puff, anyone?  Bon Appetite!

speaker: Frasier
text: At which point, the woman said to Churchill, "Sir, if you were my husband I would put poison in your coffee."  To which Churchill sorely replied, "Madame, if you were my wife I'd drink it!" [_laughs on his own_] Perhaps you've heard that story.

speaker: Alfred
text: Yes, from Churchill.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, can I freshen anyone's drink?

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps I'll just bring the bottle around.

speaker: Stephanie
text: I didn't realise that you were going to play host all night.  I mean, we've hardly had a chance to talk, and I'm afraid I'm going to have to make it an early night.  Yes, I'm leaving to Paris first thing in the morning and I was really hoping that we could spend some time alone.

speaker: Frasier
text: And so we shall.  As of this moment, it's just the two of us, you'll get my complete attention.. [_sees Elaine walking to kitchen and he runs to block her_] ...just after this.  Oh Elaine, would you like a fill up?

speaker: Elaine
text: Well actually I was seeing what Niles is up to in there, perhaps I can be of some help.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know you could pour the wine... _Niles pulls Frasier into the kitchen, he still has the towel over his head._

speaker: Frasier
text: You are totally ruining my chances with Stephanie!

speaker: Niles
text: [_sarcastic:_] Yes, that was my first concern too.  Toss. [_Frasier begins tossing salad_] You can't abandon me just because you're hoping she is just as horny as you are.

speaker: Frasier
text: The first thing you've got to do is go to the vet and have that thing removed!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, are you mad?  I can't walk through there with this thing on my head, I'd be the laughingstock of the Montana.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can't spend the night in the kitchen!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, these people live for gossip.  I've only been here three days and I already know that Peter's a letch and Carol's a lush.  What do think they'd say about me?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I've spent the last forty-five minutes with these people.  I think they are kind and understanding, I think they'll be very sympathetic with your problem.

speaker: Niles
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: You don't think they'll laugh at me?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I don't.  And furthermore, if you stay in here they'll think you're rude, bad-mannered, and - dare I say it - a bad host.

speaker: Niles
text: Fine, I'll go out there.  But if they ridicule me, let it be on your head!  Open the door.

speaker: Frasier
text: Everyone?  Excuse me, Niles has had a little mishap, he will have to go to the doctor.  It's nothing serious, he just has to have something removed.  Niles!

speaker: Frasier
text: You see, his bird suffered a kind of trauma and has attached itself to the scalp and we just...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, Frasier, this isn't necessary.  Good evening, everyone, I'm terribly sorry for all this.

speaker: Elaine
text: [_sympathetic:_] Oh Niles, you mean all this time you've been hiding in there because of your bird?  Oh, you poor thing.

speaker: Peter
text: You know, the same thing happened to my mother once, only with her cat.  Now that was a sight!

speaker: Carol
text: Who hasn't had an embarrassing moment at a party? [_drunk, she spills wine all over her and laughs_] Look, I just spilled wine on my dress!

speaker: Niles
text: This is such a relief.  I must say, I feel a bit silly for staying in there for so long.

speaker: Alfred
text: Are you in any pain?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  As long as no-one rings the doorbell I'm fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, you seem to relaxing a bit, maybe the bird will relax.  Shall we give this another minute or two, everyone? [_everyone agrees_]

speaker: Niles
text: Alright then, who needs more wine? [_he begins to pour still with the bird on his head_] Alfred, white for you. And would anyone like some cheese or a cracker?

speaker: Baby
text: Squawk.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, Baby, guests first!  Oh Carol, that dress is absolutely smashing!

speaker: Carol
text: Why, thank you.

speaker: Baby
text: Carol's a lush.

speaker: Carol
text: Did the bird just say something? Wella: It sounded like it said...

speaker: Baby
text: Carol's a lush.

speaker: Alfred
text: Where would a bird learn a phrase like that?

speaker: Niles
text: Birds today!  You don't know where they pick these things up!  Well, shall we all join Peter at the table?

speaker: Baby
text: Peter's a letch.

speaker: Peter
text: What did that say?

speaker: Niles
text: I said, "let's all sit down."

speaker: Baby
text: Peter's a letch.

speaker: Peter
text: Is this your idea of a joke?

speaker: Alfred
text: I've had quite enough of this. [_they begin to leave_]

speaker: Niles
text: Hang on Carol, don't go, I did not teach the bird these phrases, I don't know where she picked them up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, you'll stay won't you, Stephanie?

speaker: Baby
text: Stephanie's horny!

speaker: Stephanie
text: [_agape_] Oh my God, is that what you've been saying about me behind my back?!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, I never said that about you, I said that about me! I'm the horny one, all I said was you were very cute.

speaker: Baby
text: Cute but stupid!

speaker: Stephanie
text: [_sarcastic:_] Well, thank you both for a wonderful evening! Good evening!

speaker: Frasier
text: Stephanie, please let me explain.

speaker: Niles
text: [_follows her to the door_] I know we got off on the wrong foot, but we are going to be neighbours, so...  _She rings the door buzzer and holds it down, making him scream. She leaves._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... thank you very much!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh please, I lost far more than you did!

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  That was one of the most promising romantic prospects I've had in years!  What have you lost?  The respect of a parched lush and a Dutch letch!  Thanks for learning that, Baby!

speaker: Niles
text: Alright, I apologize.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  I suppose I could drive you to the vet now. Maybe we should take the service elevator?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, what's the point?  I don't think my reputation can suffer anymore than it already has.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wouldn't be so sure about that.  Wearing a white bird after Labor day!  _They leave.  End of Act Two. (Time: 21:15)_
